intro: Scrophularia valdesii, commonly known as Valdes' figwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their medicinal and ornamental value. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually pale purple or white, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the genus. Scrophularia valdesii is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
